abstract: Exposure of Russian spy ring in New York City brings up possibility of prisoner exchange with Russia; such swaps are rare in post-Cold War times, but one was made in 2010 after different spy ring was broken up.
lead_paragraph: The issue is arising after three men were accused by federal officials of working as covert agents operating in New York for the Russian foreign intelligence agency.

byline.contributor: Andrew Roth contributed reporting from Moscow.
byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and KATE PASTOR

snippet: The issue is arising after three men were accused by federal officials of working as covert agents operating in New York for the Russian foreign intelligence agency.

headline.main: After Three Russians Are Charged, the Prospect of a Spy Swap Surfaces
headline.print_headline: After Three Are Charged, Questions of Spy Swap
